alert.note: Alert for Arenac (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 12:25PM EDT until April 07 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Rifle River near Sterling affecting Arenac County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Manistee River near Sherman affecting Wexford County. For the Rifle River...including Sterling...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Manistee River...including Sherman...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rifle River near Sterling. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, High water begins to impact canoe livery at River View Campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 6.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM EDT Thursday was 6.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 3.2 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.7 feet on 04/04/2009. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued tonight as additional forecast information becomes available.
